Question
========

One researcher hypothesized that students have a have a higher heart rate than after. The heart rate of 12 students was measured just before and one hour after the exam. In one student the heart rate is the same, decreased in nine and increased in two. The null hypothesis that the examination had **no** influence on the heart rate can be rejected in the case of

Answerlist
----------

* Α = 0.01
* Α = 0.05, but not at α = 0.01
* Α = 0.10, but not at α = 0.05

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Α = 0.01: Incorrect
* Α = 0.05, but not at α = 0.01: Correct
* Α = 0.10, but not at α = 0.05: Incorrect
